sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均含"午餐"之意。
means: lunch ： 普通用词，系luncheon的略语。
luncheon比lunch正式而优雅。指在某一特定场合举行的非常正式的午餐。

sentence.Network_en: We tend to meet up for lunch once a week.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们往往每周共进一次午餐。

sentence.Network_en: Use your lunch hour to have a nap in your chair.
sentence.Network_cn: 利用午饭时间坐在椅子上打个盹吧。

sentence.Network_en: We had lunch the other day at our favorite restaurant.
sentence.Network_cn: 前两天我们在最喜欢的餐馆吃了午饭。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)temporarily not in command of one's mental faculties
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)心不在焉的，做白日梦的；发疯的；愚蠢的

phrase.cizu_name: there's no such thing as a free lunch

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)it isn't possible to get something for nothing
Not in touch with the real world; crazy.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 做白日梦的：与真实世界没关系的；疯狂的

entry.def: Lunch is the meal that you have in the middle of the day.

example.ex: Shall we meet somewhere for lunch?...
example.tran: 我们找地方见面一起吃个午饭好不好？

example.ex: He did not enjoy business lunches...

entry.def: When you lunch, you have lunch, especially at a restaurant.

example.ex: Only the extremely rich could afford to lunch at the Mirabelle...
example.tran: 只有非常有钱的人才能在米拉贝勒餐厅吃得起午餐。

example.ex: Having not yet lunched, we went to the refreshment bar for ham sandwiches.
example.tran: 我们都没吃午饭，于是便去小吃店买了火腿三明治。

entry.def: If you say there's no such thing as a free lunch, you are saying that most things that are worth having need to be paid for or worked for, and that you cannot expect to get things for nothing.

example.ex: The book includes 25 Lessons for Life: Lesson 1: There is no free lunch. Don't  feel entitled to anything you don't sweat and struggle for...
example.tran: 本书共包括25堂“人生课”：第一课，没有免费的午餐。别以为可以不劳而获。

example.ex: But, even in Hollywood, there is no such thing as a free lunch.
example.tran: 但即使是在好莱坞也没有免费的午餐。

Who is Mr Wilkinson going to have lunch with on Monday
well, I contacted his office half an hour ago, and his secretary said he was out for lunch until 2:

sentences.cn: 我不能总是供应你午餐。

jushi.english: The territory was too expensive for any one purchaser, so the two couples parcelled out a picnic lunch.
jushi.chinese: 这地方什么都贵,因此,两对夫妇分享一顿野餐。

jushi.english: Is the Prime Minister giving a lunch?
